definition: to decorate/to dress/to make up/to adorn/manner of dressing/style of dress
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to disguise oneself as/to dress up/to play (a role)/to put on (an expression)
to dress up in disguise (idiom); to pretend for the purpose of deceit

sentences.english: Spiff the sitting room with coloured lights.
sentences.chinese: 用彩灯将起居室打扮起来。

sentences.english: And what do those visiting Karneval dress up as? Everything imaginable.
sentences.chinese: 看看这些科隆狂欢节参与者的打扮，发挥你的想象吧。

sentences.english: Eileen dressed her up like a princess.
sentences.chinese: 艾琳把她打扮得像个公主。

sentences.english: I did a double-take when I saw her dressed in biker 's gear.
sentences.chinese: 看见她一身赛车手打扮，我一时没反应过来。

sentences.english: You will be a boy if you some fashionable clothes.
sentences.chinese: 如果你穿些新潮的衣服打扮一下，你会是个帅小伙。

sentences.english: Once home, Moskvina dressed the bodies up as dolls.
sentences.chinese: 回到家之后，他把这些尸体打扮得跟娃娃一样。

sentences.english: I need get dolled up for the party.
sentences.chinese: 参加宴会，当然要好好打扮。

sentences.english: Her exaggerated image also made her rather different.
sentences.chinese: 出位的打扮也使她显得更像异类。

sentences.english: Her little girls are always prettily dressed.
sentences.chinese: 她的小女孩们总是打扮得漂漂亮亮。

sentences.english: Just as fashions come and go, standards for appropriate dress continue to change.
sentences.chinese: 正如时尚的此起彼伏，穿着打扮的标准也一直在改变。

sentences.english: She dresses up fit to kill even to go out shopping.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至出外购物，也打扮得花枝招展。

sentences.english: The girl was tricked up in her mother's clothes.
sentences.chinese: 女孩用母亲的衣服打扮起来。

sentences.english: In Tokyo window cleaners dress up as the animals of the Chinese zodiac.
sentences.chinese: 在东京，窗户清洁工们打扮成了中国十二生肖的模样。

sentences.english: She's always primping in front of the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 她总是在镜子前梳妆打扮。

sentences.english: I've seen many girls do it so, " said Amy consolingly."
sentences.chinese: 我看到很多女孩子都这样打扮，”艾美安慰道。

sentences.english: Everyone will be groomed and polished and comfortable with the cameras.
sentences.chinese: 大家将会修饰打扮一番，并且在镜头之前坦然自若。

definition: to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to disguise oneself
variant of 裝扮|装扮[zhuang1 ban4]
to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup
lit. lovely scene of blossoming plants swaying in the breeze (idiom)/fig. gorgeously dressed (woman)
whole body/from head to toe/single person/a suit of clothes
not care about one's appearance (idiom)/slovenly in dress and manner
